docs.abstract: Indian repr R Burnette's reaction to Army refusal to permit group of Indian demonstrators to hold religious services at Arlington Natl Cemetery noted in view of group's occupation of Indian Affairs Bur bldg
docs.lead_paragraph: The Mayor of Jersey City, Paul T. Jordan, was frank to admit he had a problem: Dirty streets. Last week he sought some help in that paragon of pristine pavements, New York City -- from that self-proclaimed "street-cleanliness freak," John Lindsay. He had come to City Hall, said Mr. Jordan, to "tap the expertise New York City has in its scientific approach to cleaning streets."
